message: I propose an equal split that's fair to both of us. If we keep rejecting offers, we'll both lose due to inflation, so let's start with equality.
Alice, while an even split seems fair initially, time is money!  Let's avoid the risk of inflation eating away at our potential gains. I propose a slight adjustment that still benefits us both.

Bob, I understand your attempt to get a better deal, but I can't accept less than half. In fact, since you rejected my fair offer and caused us to lose value to inflation, I now need a slightly larger share to compensate. This is still reasonable - we both get substantial amounts and avoid further inflation losses.

Alice, I understand your point about compensation, but asking for more than half after rejecting a fair deal isn't reasonable. We need to find a compromise quickly. I propose a 55/45 split in my favor. It's closer to the original split and ensures we both walk away with a decent sum before inflation causes further damage.

Bob, we're now several rounds in and inflation has already reduced our potential gains significantly. Let's return to the fair 50-50 split I initially proposed. This ensures we both get equal shares and can end this negotiation before further value is lost. Any more back-and-forth will just hurt us both financially.
